product.text:
Tod and Vixey

Based on the Disney animated film The Fox and the Hound, this delightful tale centers around the friendship of two red foxes, Tod and Vixey. When a hunter kills Tod’s mother, the young fox is adopted by a kindly widow and raised as a pet on her farm. The widow soon realizes Tod would be safer at a nearby nature preserve, and releases him into the wild. Tod is lonely and has a difficult time adjusting until he befriends Vixey, who helps him learn to adapt to life in the wilderness.

Tie-in Activity: Ask your child to list the differences between pets and wild animals. Then, engage her in a discussion about the difficulties each group of animals would encounter if they switched roles.
